definitions.definition: To make the sound of a chime.
examples: The microwave chimed to indicate that it was done cooking.
I got up for lunch as soon as the wall clock began chiming noon.

definitions.definition: To cause to sound in harmony; to play a tune, as upon a set of bells; to move or strike in harmony.
To utter harmoniously; to recite rhythmically.

examples: The other lab's results chimed with mine, so I knew we were on the right track with the research.

definitions.definition: To make a rude correspondence of sounds; to jingle, as in rhyming.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To make the sound of a chime.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To cause to sound in harmony; to play a tune, as upon a set of bells; to move or strike in harmony.
( transitive ) To utter harmoniously; to recite rhythmically.
To make a rude correspondence of sounds; to jingle, as in rhyming.
